thread.title: Navratri 2015: Prime Minister Narendra Modi greets the nation on the festive occasion
thread.title_full: Navratri 2015: Prime Minister Narendra Modi greets the nation on the festive occasion

author: Shweta Parande
title: Navratri 2015: Prime Minister Narendra Modi greets the nation on the festive occasion
text:
Navratri 2015: Prime Minister Narendra Modi greets the nation on the festive occasion By Shweta Parande on October 13, 2015 at 8:31 AM Comments 
Navratri 2015 begins today, October 13, with Ghatasthapana. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has greeted the nation on the festive occasion through his official Twitter handle. Modi chose to tweet purely in Hindi – the national language of India – this time. He said, “नवरात्रि के पावन पर्व पर सभी देशवासियों को हार्दिक शुभकामनायें।” 
The Prime Minister also shared a picture of Goddess Durga, in whose name the festival is celebrated, and her nine forms. नवरात्रि के पावन पर्व पर सभी देशवासियों को हार्दिक शुभकामनायें। pic.twitter.com/it0kMkPCYR 
— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) October 13, 2015 
Navratri or the nine nights of Durga Puja is an auspicious occasion that leads up to the auspicious day of Vijayadashmi or Dussehra. The festival marks the victory of good over evil. For nine days, prayers are offered to the goddess and fast observed. 
People also participate in Dandiya dancing nights, especially the Gujaratis. Our PM belongs to the same community and we are sure Navratri holds special importance in his life. Here’s wishing Narendra Modi and the entire country a very happy Navratri 2015! Pray to the goddess and have loads of fun. 
  8:40 AM Topics:
